description:

0:10 MEASURING AND CUTTING THE PIECES - It is probably easier with a hot wire cutter. But not that hard with a somewhat sharp kitchen knife.
2:18 SHAPING THE TOP OF THE PYRAMID
3:06 STONE TEXTURE - Alternative ways to make the stone texture is by using a real stone or by pressing with rough sandpaper
4:03 FLOORS - If you have some kind of desert or stone battlemat or terrain,  you won't need to make floors for the base floor.
5:06 BASE PAINT - Because the paint is not that dark, it is recommended to paint it twice
5:47 BEIGE HIGHLIGHTS 
6:31 FLOOR "SAND TEXTURE" 
6:39 STAIRS - It might be easier to craft it from individual foam pieces
7:11 TRAPDOOR - You could also add an opening to the floor to make the trapdoor functional without gluing it in place.
7:35 PROJECT SHOWCASE - Have you made anything similar, do you have any ideas for my next projects? Share in the comments.
title: Crafting a Miniature Pyramid for D&D (Tabletop Terrain Tutorial)
